articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the famous work of leader Kim Jong Il "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" was held at the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea on November 27.
 The chairman of the institute said the Juche philosophy is, indeed, a new and original philosophy as it raises the relationship between man and the world, man's position and role in the world, as the fundamental matter of philosophy and expounds from a new angle the philosophical principle that man is the master of everything and that he decides everything.    
 Noting that the validity and vitality of the Juche idea has been fully displayed in the Korean revolution, he said the idea is being widely disseminated today in Asia, Africa, America and other parts of the world.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Slovak President 
    Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of sympathy to Ivan Gasparovic, president of Slovakia, on December 3.
 The message expressed deep sympathy to the president and, through him, to the residents of the afflicted area as regards the strong hurricane that hit Tatra area of Slovakia, causing serious damage.    
 The message wished the president and the government of Slovakia success in the efforts to remove the consequences of the disaster at an early date and stabilize the life of the residents.

articles.title: Greetings to President of European Commission
Greetings to EC Member for Development and Humanitarian Aid
articles.content:
Greetings to President of European Commission 
    Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Jose Manuel Barroso, president of the European Commission.
 The message extended congratulations to the president on his assumption of office as president of the newly formed commission and, through him, to its new members of the EC.    
 Expressing the belief that the relations between the DPRK and the European Union would continue to develop favorably in his tenure, the message wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Extraordinary Meeting of Co-Chairmen of Pomminryon Presidium Held
articles.content:
Greetings to EC Member for Development and Humanitarian Aid 
    Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs, sent a message of greetings to Louis Michel on his assumption of office as member for development and humanitarian aid of the European Commission.
 The message said the development and humanitarian aid of the European Union was making a substantial contribution to the development of relations between the European Union and other countries and to the realization of multipolorization of the world.    
 Expressing thanks to the EU for the lot of help it had rendered to the DPRK in the past period, the message hoped that the cooperation between the DPRK and the EU would continue to develop favorably and wished him success in his responsible work.
